Representation: The Chariot represents ambition, humbleness and willpower. It stands for the drive to succeed and quiet confidence in one’s abilities.
Guidance: You should seek new opportunities, take stock of your situation and trust that you are up to the challenge.
User Representation (IGN): This card often stands for travel or career advancement. It can be a reminder that life doesn’t stand still, it will proceed whether you’re ready or not.
Agent Representation (IGP): It might represent someone who isn’t afraid to push you; or whose determination you find inspiring.
Guide Interpretation: For Evelyn, The Chariot is a cascading river - it can carry you far but will be hard to swim against.

Representation: Death stands for transformation, transition or change; the certainty of ending and the possibility of rebirth.
Guidance: You should be open to new opportunities, appreciate the present before it becomes the past and take time for self-improvement.
User Representation (IGN): This isn’t as scary as it seems. Death usually represents the end of one cycle and the beginning of another. It might mean moving house or a change in lifestyle.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could denote someone who is a negative influence on your life or someone who might help you shake things up.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees Death as an unfamiliar figure bringing strange gifts.

Representation: The Devil represents temptation, attachment or darkness; the lure of desire and the constraint of weakness.
Guidance: You should acknowledge your guilty pleasures, reflect on any negative tendencies and be wary of instant gratification.
User Representation (IGN): This card usually stands for a bad habit or guilty pleasure. Possibly a lie you tell yourself or something you know you should stop doing.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could also represent someone who isn’t right for you, perhaps a person holding you back or trying to undermine you.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees the Devil as symbolic of obsession.

Representation: The Emperor represents structure, authority and strength. He is a symbol of decisiveness and the judicious use of reason.
Guidance: You should listen to an authority figure or try to understand someone’s position. Don’t be afraid to make difficult choices.
User Representation (IGN): This card stands for putting yourself first and making tough, rational choices. It suggests that now is not the time to be too emotional.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could represent someone who will help you with a problem, but it might also symbolise your rational side.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees the Emperor as someone giving you recognition or reward, what might you do to deserve it?

Representation: The Hanged Man represents observation, pause for thought or surrender; a chance for a new perspective and a reminder to be flexible.
Guidance: You should think about taking a break, remember that sunk costs cannot be recovered and consider the world from a new angle.
User Representation (IGN): This card can stand for a blockage or interruption, often it’s an idea that hasn’t quite come to fruition.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could be someone with a fresh take on your situation, or they might be the person responsible for it.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees The Hanged Man as a reminder to reconnect with the natural world.

Representation: Strength stands for courage, compassion and influence; the strength to stand up for what’s right and the confidence to admit your mistakes.
Guidance: You should be brave when going outside your comfort zone, try to persuade people to your point of view and be unwavering in the face of injustice.
User Representation (IGN): This card often represents something hidden, perhaps deliberately avoided or suppressed. It might be an emotion you find difficult that you should learn to harness.
Agent Representation (IGP): It might be a person in your life who wields a lot of influence, being strong is about knowing when to listen and when to do your own thing.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn says that Strength does not always mean power, the heart is also a muscle.

Representation: Temperance represents balance, patience and moderation; a divine sense of purpose and the floating feeling of meditation.
Guidance: You should embrace mindfulness, think about the way you consume and stay patient in the face of adversity.
User Representation (IGN): This card might suggest the need to cut back on bad habits or to take the high road in an argument.
Agent Representation (IGP): Often it stands for someone with a different viewpoint to you.
Guide Interpretation: Maledictus believes that Temperance stands for self-restraint, acting quickly can be rash.

Representation: The Tower represents upheaval, ambition or awakening; it stands proud as a symbol of change.
Guidance: You should embrace the excitement of chaos, abandon conventions that no longer work and look for new opportunities glimmering on the horizon.
User Representation (IGN): This card often stands for something unexpected and possibly destructive, a force that will upset the order of things and leave you to put the pieces back together.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could symbolise someone who will be your rock during this period, or they might be the person in the eye of the storm.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn considers The Tower to be guarding self-knowledge, what could be hidden at the top?

Representation: The Wheel of Fortune represents luck, destiny or unpredictability; the chaotic pattern of existence or the happy accident of good fortune.
Guidance: You should embrace the unexpected, risk trying new things and remember that you cannot control every detail.
User Representation (IGN): This card often stands for a surprise or a change in direction. It can be a reminder to stay open to new experiences.
Agent Representation (IGP): If it stands for a person they are likely to be involved in transforming your life in some way.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees The Wheel of Fortune as the promise of fate, you will end up where you’re meant to be.

Representation: The world represents achievement, accomplishment and travel; the promise of discovery and the satisfaction of completion.
Guidance: You should take a moment to be proud of your success, remember to take stock of things that make you happy and finish any passion projects.
User Representation (IGN): This card usually represents a milestone in your life, often one coming as a result of hard work. It’s a reminder to celebrate and reflect.
Agent Representation (IGP): It could stand for someone special in your life, often a lover, ally or friend who will be at your side forever.
Guide Interpretation: Evelyn sees The World as a collection of stories, listen to what others have seen and let them guide you.
